title: Functions supporting data analysis with R at KWB
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install kwb.base in R install.packages('kwb.base')  # Browse the kwb.base manual pages help(package = 'kwb.base')

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — fillup
text: Based time series given "tseries" new time series generated timestamps lacking tseries included. Optionally missing values generated interpolation existing values.

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — fillup
code: fillup(   tseries,   tsField,   step_s,   forceStep,   interpol,   includeOrig,   default = NA,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — fillup
text: tseries data frame representing time-series values tsField Name timestamp column tseries. Default: name first available POSIXt-column step_s Time step seconds shall lie consecutive timestamps. Non-existing timestamps generated. forceStep TRUE, timestamps multiples time step given step_s put result data frame interpol TRUE, returned data frame value column contain corresponding column containing interpolated values includeOrig TRUE interpol = TRUE original columns remain output addition columns containing (original plus interpolated) values. default value used enough (least ) non-NA values used interpolation. Default: NA dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — fillup
text: Returns data.frame

text: output device pdf file result dev.()   command returned.

title: X-Y Plot of Two Database Table Fields — hsDbTablePlotXY
code: if (FALSE) { ## Plot CSB vs. timestamp values from table "tbl_STA_CAL" in the ## example database into a window on the screen hsDbTablePlotXY(kwb.db::xmdb(), "tbl_Qua", "myDateTime", "CSB")  ## Set paths to a test PDF file pdf_file <- file.path(tempdir(), "ex_hsDbTablePlotXY.pdf")  ## Plot CSBf vs. timestamp values from the same table into a PDF file. hsDbTablePlotXY(kwb.db::xmdb(), "tbl_Qua", "myDateTime", "CSBf", pdf_file)  ## Open PDF file in PDF viewer kwb.utils::hsShowPdf(pdf_file) }

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — hsFillUp
text: Based time series given "tseries" new time series generated timestamps lacking tseries included. Optionally missing values generated interpolation existing values.

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — hsFillUp
code: hsFillUp(   tseries,   tsField = names(tseries)[kwb.utils::posixColumnAtPosition(tseries)[1]],   step_s = 60,   forceStep = TRUE,   limits = NULL,   interpol = TRUE,   includeOrig = TRUE,   default = NA,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — hsFillUp
text: tseries data frame representing time-series values tsField Name timestamp column tseries. Default: name first available POSIXt-column step_s Time step seconds shall lie consecutive timestamps. Non-existing timestamps generated. forceStep TRUE, timestamps multiples time step given step_s put result data frame limits data frame matrix exactly two columns containing first last timestamp intervals timestamps generated. interpol TRUE, returned data frame value column contain corresponding column containing interpolated values includeOrig TRUE interpol = TRUE original columns remain output addition columns containing (original plus interpolated) values. default value used enough (least ) non-NA values used interpolation. Default: NA dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Fill-up with Missing Timestamps — hsFillUp
text: Returns data.frame

what: Filter Rows Within Time Period — hsFilterPeriod
title: Filter Rows Within Time Period — hsFilterPeriod
text: Filters data.frame containing time series data time interval minDate maxDate.

title: Filter Rows Within Time Period — hsFilterPeriod
code: hsFilterPeriod(   tSeries,   minDate,   maxDate,   tsField,   maxIncluded = FALSE,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Filter Rows Within Time Period — hsFilterPeriod
text: tSeries data.frame containing time-series data. minDate lower boundary time interval selected, either POSIXt-object, Date object string ISO format: yyyy-mm-dd maxDate upper boundary time interval selected, either POSIXt-object, Date object string ISO format: yyyy-mm-dd tsField name time stamp column tseries. maxIncluded TRUE, maxDate included time interval filtered , otherwise included (see Details). dbg TRUE debug messages shown

title: Filter Rows Within Time Period — hsFilterPeriod
text: Returns tSeries, reduced rows representing time within   selected time interval minDate maxDate

title: Filter Rows Within Time Period — hsFilterPeriod
text: minDate maxDate must given character string ISO format: “yyyy-mm-dd [HH:MM:SS]”, brackets indicate time information optional. lower boundary always included time interval selected, whereas upper boundary included maxIncluded TRUE otherwise excluded. maxIncluded = FALSE easy select whole months whole years setting maxDate first day next month/year.

what: Two-field Grouping of a Data Frame — hsGroupBy2Fields
title: Two-field Grouping of a Data Frame — hsGroupBy2Fields
text: Groups data values two columns creating matrix many rows distinct values field1 many columns distinct values field2. matrix contains sum values specified value field belong corresponding value combination field1/field2

title: Two-field Grouping of a Data Frame — hsGroupBy2Fields
code: hsGroupBy2Fields(   frmData,   strValField,   strField1,   strField2,   boolDesc1 = FALSE,   boolDesc2 = FALSE )

title: Two-field Grouping of a Data Frame — hsGroupBy2Fields
text: frmData data.frame containing data grouped. strValField name value field (= column frmData) strField1 name first field grouped strField2 name second field grouped boolDesc1 TRUE, columns result matrix ordered according decreasing values field1 boolDesc2 TRUE, rows result matrix ordered according decreasing values field2

title: Two-field Grouping of a Data Frame — hsGroupBy2Fields
text: matrix many rows distinct values field1   many columns distinct values field2 input   data.frame. matrix contains sum values specified value   field input data.frame belong corresponding combination   values field1/field2

what: Group Data in Time Intervals — hsGroupByInterval
title: Group Data in Time Intervals — hsGroupByInterval
text: Builds groups rows belonging time interval aggregates values within group using given function (e.g. sum, mean, min, max)

title: Group Data in Time Intervals — hsGroupByInterval
code: hsGroupByInterval(   data,   interval,   FUN,   tsField = names(data)[1],   offset1 = 0,   offset2 = interval/2,   limits = FALSE,   ...,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Group Data in Time Intervals — hsGroupByInterval
text: data data frame containing timestamp field data fields aggregated time. interval length time interval seconds FUN function used aggregate values within one interval, e.g. sum, mean, min, max tsField name timestamp column, default: name first column offset1 number seconds timestamps shifted grouped intervals. grouping intervals done dividing timestamps (converted number seconds since 1970-01-01) interval length taking integer part division interval number. Thus, offset1 = 0 interval length e.g. 60 seconds, first interval 00:00:00 00:00:59, second 00:01:00 00:01:59 etc., whereas offset1 = 30 case lead intervals 00:00:30 00:01:29, 00:01:30 00:02:29 etc.. offset2 value given seconds determining timestamps interval represents interval output. 0, time interval represented smallest timestamp belonging interval. default, offset2 half interval length, meaning time interval represented timestamp middle interval. limits TRUE, two additional columns added showing minimum maximum value interval ... arguments passed aggregate, internally called function dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Group Data in Time Intervals — hsGroupByInterval
code: ## Get an example time-series with values every one minute step <- 60 df <- hsExampleTSeries(step) #> Error in hsExampleTSeries(step): could not find function "hsExampleTSeries"  ## Calculate 5-min-means with ## offset1 = 0 (default), offset2 = interval/2 (default) df.agg1 <- hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 5*step, mean, limits = TRUE) #> Error in hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 5 * step, mean, limits = TRUE): could not find function "hsGroupByInterval" df.agg1 #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'df.agg1' not found  ## Shift the interval limits with ## offset1 = 2.5*60, offset2 = interval/2 (default) df.agg2 <- hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 5*step, mean, limits = TRUE,                              offset1 = 2.5*step) #> Error in hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 5 * step, mean, limits = TRUE,     offset1 = 2.5 * step): could not find function "hsGroupByInterval" df.agg2 #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'df.agg2' not found  ## Shift the timestamps representing the intervals with ## offset1 = 0, offset2 = 0 df.agg3 <- hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 5*step, mean, limits = TRUE,                              offset1 = 0, offset2 = 0) #> Error in hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 5 * step, mean, limits = TRUE,     offset1 = 0, offset2 = 0): could not find function "hsGroupByInterval" df.agg3 #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'df.agg3' not found  ## Show a plot demonstrating the effect of offset1 and offset2 if (FALSE) { demoGroupByInterval(df) } ## Handling NA values...  ## Set y to NA at 2 random positions df[sample(nrow(df), 2), 2] <- NA #> Error in sample.int(length(x), size, replace, prob): invalid first argument df ## Let' have a look at df #> function (x, df1, df2, ncp, log = FALSE)  #> { #>     if (missing(ncp))  #>         .Call(C_df, x, df1, df2, log) #>     else .Call(C_dnf, x, df1, df2, ncp, log) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x0000020367b764c8> #> <environment: namespace:stats>  ## Count NA values per group hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 300, function(x){sum(is.na(x))}) #> Error in hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 300, function(x) {    sum(is.na(x))}): could not find function "hsGroupByInterval"  ## default behaviour: mean(values containing at least one NA) = NA hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 300, mean) #> Error in hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 300, mean): could not find function "hsGroupByInterval"  ## ignore NA values by passing na.rm = TRUE to the aggregate function hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 300, mean, na.rm = TRUE) #> Error in hsGroupByInterval(df, interval = 300, mean, na.rm = TRUE): could not find function "hsGroupByInterval"

what: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value — hsLabValToVal
title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value — hsLabValToVal
text: conversion text representing number, possibly starting "<" ">" indicate number exceeds detection limit analysis method, valid number

title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value — hsLabValToVal
code: hsLabValToVal(   x,   country,   detLimFactorBelow = 0.5,   detLimFactorAbove = 2,   factors = c(`<` = detLimFactorBelow, `<<` = detLimFactorBelow, `>` =     detLimFactorAbove, `>>` = detLimFactorAbove),   stopOnError = TRUE )

title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value — hsLabValToVal
text: x (vector ) character(s) representing values, possibly starting "<" ">" indicate detection limit exceedance country "en" value given English format (decimal point ".", thousands separator ",") "de" value given German format (decimal point ",", thousands separator "."). detLimFactorBelow factor detection limit multiplied order get valid value value detection limit. Default value: 0.5 detLimFactorAbove factor detection limit multiplied order get valid value value detection limit. Default value: 2 factors named vector conversion factors multiplied numeric values name factor matches prefix (e.g. "<", "<<", ">", ">>") found front value. Set NULL factors applied stopOnError TRUE, program stops conversion errors, otherwise shows warning

title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value — hsLabValToVal
text: data frame columns outOfLimit one "" (value   within detection limits), "<" (value detection limit) ">" (value   detection limit) numericValue containing value ,   case detection limit exceedance, may substitute value.   conversion errors, column numericValue containing   indices wrongly formatted values attribute "errorIndices".

what: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value (Old Version) — hsLabValToVal_old
title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value (Old Version) — hsLabValToVal_old
text: Conversion text representing number, possibly starting "<" ">" indicate number exceeds detection limit analysis method, valid number

title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value (Old Version) — hsLabValToVal_old
code: hsLabValToVal_old(   x,   country,   detLimFactorBelow = 0.5,   detLimFactorAbove = 2,   stopOnError = TRUE )

title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value (Old Version) — hsLabValToVal_old
text: x (vector ) character(s) representing values, possibly starting "<" ">" indicate detection limit exceedance country "en" value given English format (decimal point ".", thousands separator ",") "de" value given German format (decimal point ",", thousands separator "."). detLimFactorBelow factor detection limit multiplied order get valid value value detection limit. Default value: 0.5 detLimFactorAbove factor detection limit multiplied order get valid value value detection limit. Default value: 2 stopOnError TRUE, program stops conversion errors, otherwise shows warning

title: Laboratory Value to Numeric Value (Old Version) — hsLabValToVal_old
text: data frame columns outOfLimit one "" (value   within detection limits), "<" (value detection limit) ">" (value   detection limit) numericValue containing value ,   case detection limit exceedance, may substitute value.   conversion errors, column numericValue containing   indices wrongly formatted values attribute "errorIndices".

title: Sequence of Timestamps — hsMkTimestamps
text: Creates timestamps first timestamp distance step.s seconds timestamps. mdb given, timestamps written database table timestamp field primary key.

title: Sequence of Timestamps — hsMkTimestamps
code: hsMkTimestamps(from, to, step.s = 60, mdb, tbl, dbg = FALSE)

title: Sequence of Timestamps — hsMkTimestamps
text: first timestamp ISO-Syntax: yyyy-mm-dd [HH:MM:SS] part brackets optional. last timestamp ISO-Syntax: yyyy-mm-dd [HH:MM:SS] part brackets optional. step.s time step timestamps seconds. mdb Optional. Full path MS Access database file (*.mdb). tbl Optional. Name table created mdb. name given name type tblfrom_to_to_step.s_s created. table given name exists, non-existing name generated first, existing tables overwritten. dbg TRUE, debug messages shown.

title: Sequence of Timestamps — hsMkTimestamps
text: Returns vecotor timestamps mdb missing nothing   timestamp table generated database given mdb.

title: Sequence of Timestamps — hsMkTimestamps
code: if (FALSE) { ## Write timestamps of January 2011 with five minutes step into example db. hsMkTimestamps("2011-01-01", "2011-02-01", 300, kwb.db::xmdb()) }  ## Output: # Timestamps have been written to table #   'tblTimestamps_2011_01_01_to_2011_02_01_300s' in # 'C:/Users/hsonne/Documents/R/win-library/2.14/ #   kwb.base/extdata/RExKwbBase.mdb'. # Timestamp field has been set as primary key.

title: Select Time Interval — selectTimeInterval
text: x data frame least one time column t1 first timestamp text, yyyy-mm-dd format t2 optional. last timestamp text, yyyy-mm-dd format width interval width text containing number unit (one "d" - day, "h" - hour, "m" - minute). E.g. "7d" = 7 days, "20m" = 20 minutes. number may negative indicating "last <number> units". posixColumn name number column x containing relevant timestamps dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: kwb.base 0.5.0 2022-06-09
text: Harmonise R package kwb.pkgbuild, e.g. use GitHub actions CI (instead travis/appeyor) Remove DEPENDS use IMPORTS explicitly listing used functions DESCRIPTION file Added NEWS.md file track changes package. see https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html writing good NEWS.md

title: kwb.base 0.4.0 2018-06-15
text: Convert inlinedocs comments Roxygen comments. Move https://github.com/kwb-r/kwb.base version (former versions version control SVN within KWB intranet!)

title: kwb.base 0.3.0
text: hsFileLines removed (simply use readLines) hsPrepPdf, hsShowPdf, hsMatrixToListForm moved kwb.utils

title: kwb.base 0.2.4
text: package now depends kwb.utils, kwb.db hsQuoteChr, hsSafeName, hsToPosix moved kwb.utils database related functions now kwb.db

title: kwb.base 0.2.3
text: new functions: hsFilterRowsWithValuesInColumns, hsSetNamedMatrixColumnsToValues, hsRenameColumns

title: kwb.base 0.2.2
text: new functions: hsDumpMdb, hsSetForeignKey, hsMovingMean hsJoinEvents: can now used events produced hsEventsOnChange

title: kwb.base 0.2.1
text: new function: hsSubstSpecChars

title: kwb.base 0.2.0
text: preliminary version distributed MIA-CSO partners

title: kwb.base 0.1.6
text: xmdb: now returning path example-mdb package’s sub-folder “extdata” hsEvents: data frame given, first column assumed contain timestamps new arg “evtSepOp” hsGetEvent: new arg ‘useIndex’ hsGroupByInterval: new arg ‘…’ New functions hsNiceLabels, hsDateStr, hsDaylightSaving, hsST2WT

title: kwb.base 0.1.5
text: hsFields: bug fix. Now supporting table names spaces/special characters. New functions hsGetEvent, hsGroupByInterval

title: kwb.base 0.1.4
text: hsSigWidth: New arg ‘dbg’, respection time unit hsMergeEvents, hsJoinEvents: respection optional event pauses time units hsEvents: New args ‘pause’, ‘tUnit’ New functions hsAddMissingCols, hsDelEmptyCols, hsEventsToUnit

title: kwb.base 0.1.3
text: hsShowPdf: enabling paths containing spaces hsMdbTimeSeries, hsGetTimeSeries: New arg ‘inclLast’ New functions hsCheckForCols, hsSigWidth, hsMergeEvents, hsJoinEvents

title: kwb.base 0.1.2
text: hsNearestStepMult: New arg ‘direction’ allows “rounding” timestamps nearest, nearest smaller, nearest greater time step multiple. callers changed. New functions hsFileLines, hsShowPdf
